job_title: RN Case Manager in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Autonomy and work in the community. Not confined to a hospital for the shift.
cons: Stress and expectations of the position are hard to meet at times.

review_title: cliquey...very much a girlfriend hiring environment
job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: The opportunity to assist and support patients in need and their families in health crisis moments. Medical Directors were very willing to hear all levels of need for patients and make decisions accordingly, not necessarily by a template. Levels of Care opportunities for all ...home health, palliative and hospice.
cons: Very strongly interwoven girl-friend environment that is great if you benefit and are Qualified but a huge negative overall in every aspect if you are not. The proverbial * rolls downhill and if you cannot integrate into that clique you are seen as a trouble maker rule breaker and a nuisance. Rules for Thee not for Me- is a very prevalent unspoken mission statement in PAC. Additionally communication is spotty. Procedures are made and not followed through consistently by all parties. Very disappointing professional representation from the top down .

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Coworkers you can connect with are great. However, if you get caught chatting for a minute, you will get in trouble.
cons: Very high workloads, cutting staff to below bare minimum and just divvy up the work to remaining team members. You keep thinking it will get better, but then, it just gets worse. No flexibility, and they cherry pick who gets to work from home. If you're in finance or HR, expect to be in the office 8-5, and people brag about not taking a lunch or break to prove their dedication.

job_title: Hospice Chaplain in New Port Richey, FL
pros: Great Staff, Supportive management, Good schedules. Good opportunities
cons:
Lots of charting
But this is true of all healthcare

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Tampa, FL
pros: Patient care and ability to travel
cons: Micromanaged, no work/life balance and on call awful

review_title: A Company that Cares About Employees
job_title: Executive Assistant in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Generous benefit plan, good inter-departmental cooperation.
cons: Can get very busy, but that isn't really bad.

review_title: Promotions aren't usually a good thing
pros:
Flexible schedule (field staff)
Worthwhile cause
Fair pay
Usually good benefits
Amazing experience
cons:
On call shifts
Can be hard to maintain work/life balance for field staff due to care/documentation requirements
Repeatedly reminded Nursing/physicians matter most of all, other disciplines and support staff treated as second class workers. 
Promotions often precursor to being fired
Senior Management more worried about bottom line and "expanding to become...," not patients and definitely not staff
Lack of staff retention (toxic environment)
Extreme and repeated changes in caseloads due to forever being short staffed ( going from 35/40 to 80/90+ overnight)
Senior Management asks for feedback, but often ignores it.

job_title: Patient Care in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Direct care staff work very hard and care despite extremely high case loads and high stress.
cons: Very difficult to balance work and personal life due to high case loads. Overtime is frowned upon and if you do ask for it, your productivity is questioned.

review_title: Great benefits and culture of employee appreciation
job_title: Management in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: The leadership/executive team does a great job to show employees that they are appreciated, not only during the holiday season, but throughout the year. The benefits are great, and the majority of the employees are easy to get along with and always willing to help. I have always had great experience with the executive team. The CEO's door is always open and she is always willing to help and offer guidance.
cons: The task of working in hospice can be daunting, but not all positions involve direct patient care.

pros: Kind and compashionnent staff,  vacation accrual is more than competitive, opportunities to advance and grow in almost any position
cons: Working autonomously can be difficult, some departments need more help than others and it can affect your job because your support goes away, pay for nurses with 20+ years experience not competitive

pros: It’s hospice. A true passion aside from the company.
cons: Upper management is terrible. Too many chiefs and not enough Indians, poor business practices, too many “unnecessary/undeserved promotions” etc.

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Great co-workers for the most part.
cons: Ridiculously naive Mangers and Directors who don't appreciate the contributions of veteran employees.

job_title: Director in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Great work life balance, amazing resources available to help grow my career, supportive and team player environment.
cons: I have not experienced any downsides during my employment.

job_title: Manager in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: Great benefits, employee appreciation, career growth and great team to work with!
cons: No complaints, CEO is forward thinking and visionary!

job_title: Executive Team Leader in Land O' Lakes, FL
pros: CEO is a visionary leader, engages with all staff, encourages and supports innovation .
cons: I have been employed by Gulfside for many years and there are none that I can think of.

pros: Salary and flexability. Line staff was considerate and helpfull.
cons: Upper management will not stay in the management lane. Higher up unprofessional, judgemental, and imposes her values on others.
